meanings.definition: Not engaging in or involving combat or fighting.
meanings.sent1: The noncombative approach to problem-solving helped avoid any arguments.
meanings.sent2: She had a noncombative attitude, always preferring peaceful resolutions.
meanings.sent3: The noncombative cat refused to play with the feisty dog.
meanings.sent4: His noncombative nature was like a shield against confrontation.
meanings.sent5: The noncombative stance of the group made them stand out in the heated debate.

meanings.definition: Tending not to provoke or incite conflict or aggression.
meanings.sent1: The noncombative language used in the negotiation kept the discussion calm.
meanings.sent2: Being noncombative in his responses, he defused the tense situation.
meanings.sent3: The noncombative tone of the email prevented any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her noncombative behavior was like a soothing balm in the argument.
meanings.sent5: The noncombative presence of the teacher helped maintain order in the classroom.
